extendedInfo.description: The FREE Bible app now translated into Latin!  Faith Comes By Hearing in partnership with the Vatican Press recorded the Latin Edition of the New Testament, the Neo-Vulgate, for use in Catholic seminaries, parishes, and personal individual study around the world.  Included in the Latin version are various Psalms and Scripture readings in Gregorian chant.  The Neo-Vulgate is currently the typical Latin edition published by the Catholic Church for use in the Roman Rite. As the first vernacular version of the Bible, it is only fitting that it be among the languages in which Faith Comes by Hearing makes the Holy Scriptures available in audio using the rendering of the translator, St. Jerome.St. Jeromeâs workBorn Eusebius Hieronymous Sophronius, Saint Jerome was a prolific writer and a powerful voice in the Christian community.  He lived from 342 B.C to 420 B.C. and devoted his life to accurately translating the Holy Bible from Hebrew and Greek into Latin.  The writings of Jerome express a scholarship unsurpassed in the early church and helped to create the cultural tradition of the Middle Ages.  Jerome revised his works several times to gain the best translations of the times, still existing and in use today.Message from Pope Benedict XVIâ. . . I ask that future priests, from their time in the seminary, receive the preparation needed to understand and to celebrate Mass in Latin, and also to use Latin texts and execute Gregorian chant. . . .â  (Pope Benedict XVI, Sacramentum Caritatis, 2007)Liturgical SignificanceâThe Roman Church has special obligations towards Latin, the splendid language of ancient Rome, and she must manifest them whenever the occasion presents itself.â - Pope John Paul II, Dominicae Cenae, 1980âThe use of Latin language. . . is to be preserved in the Latin rites.â - Vatican II, Sacrosanctum Concilium [Constitution on the Sacred Liturgy], no. 36âCare must be taken to ensure that the faithful may also be able to say or sing together in Latin those parts of the Ordinary of the Mass which pertain to them.â - Sacrosanctum Concilium, no. 54âI believe this is a worthwhile project. With the renewed interest in Latin in the Church these days, a recording of the spoken Scriptures does have a place. An ancillary benefit would be the availability of another opportunity for students of Latin to hear a new recording of spoken Latin.ââ James F. Pauer , President, Latin Liturgy AssociationâFrom an academic point of view, I can assert that there is considerable scholarly interest in the Latin Vulgate because it is the substratum for the prayers of the Roman liturgy and offers the spiritual milieu for it.  To hear, as well as to read, the Holy Scriptures in Latin â the first language into which the original Hebrew and Greek were translated â would be a wonderful source for reinforcement of biblically grounded faith as well as cultural enrichment.â â Rev. Thomas M. Kocik, Editor, Antiphon: A Journal for Liturgical Renewal

reviews.title: Just an Error in Summary of application
reviews.comment: Mira quidem pertinet ad solum sacerdotem ordinatum Anglicani studiosum etiam diuinis divinitatis, vel tead velit justo metaphysica, tum latine Biblia legendi. Feci animadverto unus minor error in vestri summarium de opus ad quod date in qua COMULA Hieronymus vixit et translatus Novum Testamentum. Hoc factum fuit in 342-420 AD non BC. Si minus mutari potest facere religionem intelligimus nova perturbantur PhD qui scriptum novi centum annis ante natiuitatem Domini nostri Iesu Christi et mors. Verisimile multi
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Excellent
reviews.comment: Exactly what I was looking for! Excellent.
reviews.author: Pedro Carneiro

reviews.title: Samsung Galaxy S2 I727
reviews.comment: This app is outstanding...works great; no issues...really helps with learning Latin and proper pronunciation
reviews.author: Robert Brian Withrow

reviews.title: Correction.
reviews.comment: With all due respect, St Jerome lived 342 - 420 AD. Not BC. Please correct this in the blurb, as it may cause so some confusion.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: AMAZING
reviews.comment: now I can read the Bible in latin, Thanks I really appreciate your work.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Wow!
reviews.comment: I love listening to the Bible in Latin! Beautifully done.  Hearing the chants make you feel like you are in a holy place.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Wow
reviews.comment: This sounds great!  I know it will be a blessing to those who can be ministered by hearing the Latin Bible.  God Bless!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Broke my device
reviews.comment: Don\'t install this on the prs-t1. It sent it into an eternal loop. I had to reset, which caused other problems and forced me to reflash.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Beautiful app!
reviews.comment: The Latin sounds so wonderful and I love the chants. Such a spiritual feeling listening. Reminds me of the beautiful Latin masses of my childhood.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: App
reviews.comment: This is a solid app for what it is. I am not a huge fan of Ecclesiastical Latin however.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: I listened to LatinMass as a little girl.  This brings back wonderful memories of worshipping God with my family
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Something for the soul
reviews.comment: Outstanding. I am grateful as it is free. Many thanks to the developers.

reviews.title: Jerry
reviews.comment: Jerry A historic recording and wonderful. Saint Jerome would be ecstatic.

reviews.title: The Bible in Latin
reviews.comment: How amazing! To be able to hear the word in Latin is wonderful. Thank you!

reviews.title: Celebrate this new Language!
reviews.comment: May the Lord Bless His Word, to His People, in their Heart Language, to bring Him glory.
